reviews.review: Wasn't funny, wasn't good. Plain awful! Save your money
I only rated it 5 stars for the meme lololol this movie sucks
My niece's enjoyed the movie, probably because they love Emojis, but this movie was horrible!
Just a painful to watch.  A god awful "movie" that felt like it would never end.

This movie is the pinnacle of perfection. Diverse, accepting and beautiful. The emoji movie is a perfect film. It teaches our children to accept one another through understandable terms. It's heart moving, action packed and not to mention hilarious. I recommend highly seeing the emoji movie.
They delayed Popeye just for this cancerous work of art!?

Before I even begin I would like to say that this film is a work of art, from the simple, yet breathtaking, animation, to the absolutely astounding characters and story, this film is perfect in every definition of the word. The star studded cast truly brings this heartwarming story to life, at one moment it will have you on the edge of your seat with tears swelling in your eyes, the next you will be laughing out loud (or, dare I say, lol?). The humor in this film is far too deep and meaningful for mere children however, so I suggest watching this film alone in the dark, rubbing essential body oils on your bare stomach, be sure you get it in every nook and cranny, you wouldn't want to anger your skin.

I would give The Emoji Movie a 10/10, the excessive use of the N word was a bit much though.

it... it exists I guess, so that's a plus, wait no that's still a negative because 
CHILDREN ARE BEING BORN INTO THE WORLD WHERE THIS IS CONSIDERED CINEMA! Patrick Stewart is shit in this movie, take that how you please.

This movie was amazing. At first I was a little upset that I had to sit through this movie for the sake of my little sister but I really enjoyed it. The story line was heartwarming and funny. This is by far the best children's movie that I've seen in the past couple of years. Definitely go see this movie even if you thought about skipping this one. I know you won't regret it.
